trans-unit.source: Provides a user interface that can edit most types of collections at design time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor"></xref> class using the specified collection type.
The type of the collection for this editor to edit.
Cancels changes to the collection.
Indicates whether original members of the collection can be removed.
When implemented in a derived class, this method indicates whether the specified value can be removed from the collection.
By default, this method always returns `true`.
This method is called when the user tries to remove an item that is an original member of the collection.
This method is not called when removing items that were added in the current editing session because they are not yet part of the collection.
The value to remove.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if it is permissible to remove this value from the collection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether multiple collection items can be selected at once.
This method indicates whether multiple collection members can be selected within the collection editor dialog box.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if it multiple collection members can be selected at the same time; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
By default, this returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets the data type of each item in the collection.
This property represents the data type of the items of the collection.
The data type of the collection items.
Gets the data type of the collection object.
This property represents the data type of the collection object.
The data type of the collection object.
Gets a type descriptor that indicates the current context.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that indicates the context currently in use, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no context is available.
Creates a new form to display and edit the current collection.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionForm> to provide as the user interface for editing the collection.
Gets the data type that this collection contains.
You can retrieve the data type of the items of the collection from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionItemType%2A> property, which is faster than this method.
This method does not need to be called by users, except in derived classes where this method has been overridden and implemented.
The default implementation of this method returns the data type of the `Item` property of the collection, if it exists.
The data type of the items in the collection, or an <xref:System.Object> if no <xref uid="langword_csharp_Item" name="Item" href=""></xref> property can be located on the collection.
Creates a new instance of the specified collection item type.
The type of item to create.
A new instance of the specified object.
Gets the data types that this collection editor can contain.
You can retrieve the data type of the items of the collection from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.NewItemTypes%2A> property, which is faster than this method.
This method does not need to be called by users, except in derived classes where this method has been overridden and implemented.
The default implementation of this method returns the type of all the collection items in a Type array.
An array of data types that this collection can contain.
Destroys the specified instance of the object.
The object to destroy.
Edits the value of the specified object using the specified service provider and context.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that can be used to gain additional context information.
A service provider object through which editing services can be obtained.
The object to edit the value of.
The new value of the object.
If the value of the object has not changed, this should return the same object it was passed.
An attempt to check out a file that is checked into a source code management program did not succeed.
Retrieves the display text for the given list item.
The list item for which to retrieve display text.
The display text for value.
Gets the edit style used by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.EditValue*> method.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that can be used to gain additional context information.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle"></xref> enumeration value indicating the provided editing style.
If the method is not supported in the specified context, this method will return the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle"></xref> identifier.
Gets an array of objects containing the specified collection.
The collection to edit.
An array containing the collection objects, or an empty object array if the specified collection does not inherit from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
Returns a list containing the given object
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> returned as an object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> which contains the individual objects to be created.
Gets the requested service, if it is available.
The type of service to retrieve.
An instance of the service, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the service cannot be found.
Gets the Help keyword to display the Help topic or topic list for when the editor's dialog box Help button or the F1 key is pressed.
Override this property to display a different Help topic.
The Help keyword to display the Help topic or topic list for when Help is requested from the editor.
Gets the available types of items that can be created for this collection.
This property indicates the data types that can be added to the collection.
By default, this returns a single type of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionItemType%2A>.
If more than one type is returned, the collection editor UI provides a way to choose which item type to create.
The types of items that can be created.
Sets the specified array as the items of the collection.
If setting requires that a new object be created, the new object is returned.
Otherwise, the `editValue` parameter is returned.
The collection to edit.
An array of objects to set as the collection items.
The newly created collection object or, otherwise, the collection indicated by the editValue parameter.
Displays the default Help topic for the collection editor.
